page.title: 02THE CANAL
page.content: The canal passing through our area is the Ellesmere canal known locally as the Llangollen canal, which was completed in 1805. This canal was built by Thomas Telford and goes from Hurleston, near Nantwich, where it links up with the Shropshire Union Canal, and goes through Whitchurch, Ellesmere, and Chirk to Llangollen. The boats used on the canal were originally to carry heavy goods from industrial areas in the days when road transport was very poor. The boatman and his family would live in a small cabin in the back of the boat. Living conditions were not good and they were very poor.
